intro: Stellilabium anacristinae, commonly known as the star-labium orchid, is a rare and enigmatic species native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring elongated, spurred petals that resemble a star. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to tree trunks and branches in the dense canopy. Its flowers are small but striking, with a complex arrangement of sepals and petals that aid in pollination by specific insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Stellilabium anacristinae is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
